submitter_participant_id.name: submitter_participant_id
submitter_participant_id.description: Identifier of the participant, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

submitter_donor_id.description: Identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

submitter_donor_id.description: Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider
submitter_donor_id.name: submitter_donor_id

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.
Partial date of birth may be provided minimum of year of birth
Data from administrative health record, medical record or self-reported

French Canadian trace their ancestry to French colonists who settled in Canada, English Canadians are of English ethnic origin and heritage, Aboriginal (First Nations, Metis, Inuit), White (European descent), Arab (e.g. Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Lebanon), Latin American (Hispanic), Black (African/Caribbean), East Asian (e.g. China, Japan, Korea, Taiwan), West Asian (e.g. Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan), Southeast Asian (e.g. Malaysia, Indonesia, Viet Nam), South Asian (e.g. India, Sri Lanka, Pakistan, Bangladesh), Filipino, Unknown, Other

vital_status.description: Donor's last known state of living or deceased
vital_status.name: vital_status

cause_of_death.description: Indicates the cause of a donor's death
cause_of_death.name: cause_of_death

meta.notes: Cause of death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is 'Deceased'.

age_of_death.description: Numeric value to represent the age of the donor at the time of death, in days
age_of_death.name: age_of_death

meta.notes: Age_of_death is only required to be submitted if the donor's vital_status is Deceased.

physical_measures_available.description: Indicate if physical measures are available for this donor
physical_measures_available.name: physical_measures_available

laboratory_measures_available.description: Indicate if laboratory meausres are available for this donor
laboratory_measures_available.name: laboratory_measures_available

lifestyle_available.description: Indicate if lifestyle and behavior data is available for this donor
lifestyle_available.name: lifestyle_available

medication_available.description: Indicate if information about medication use is available for this donor
medication_available.name: medication_available

environment_exposure_available.description: Indicate if information about environmental exposure is available for this donor
environment_exposure_available.name: environment_exposure_available

family_history_available.description: Indicate if information about the donor's family health history is available
family_history_available.name: family_history_available

genealogy_available.description: Indicate the donor's availability of genealogical data
genealogy_available.name: genealogy_available

is_a_proband.description: Indicate if the donor is a proband or a family member
is_a_proband.name: is_a_proband

is_affected.description: Indicate if the donor is affected by the condition
is_affected.name: is_affected

notes.right: Terms are taken from NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

age_biospecimen_collection.description: Age (in days) of participant when biospecimen was collected
age_biospecimen_collection.name: age_biospecimen_collection

cancer_biospecimen_type.name: cancer_biospecimen_type
cancer_biospecimen_type.description: Description of the kind of biospecimen that was collected (specific to cancer) based on  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt)

cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_sou.name: cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_source_text
cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_sou.description: Indicate the anatomic location where the biospecimen was collected (cancer specific)

meta.notes: Use the term that was used when collecting the biospecimen

cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_nci.name: cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_ncit_code
cancer_biospecimen_anatomic_location_nci.description: Indicate the  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) code for the anatomic location of the biospecimen

meta.notes: Refer to  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

tumor_histological_type_source_text.name: tumor_histological_type_source_text
tumor_histological_type_source_text.description: The histology of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report

meta.notes: Use the term that was used in the pathology report

tumor_histological_type_ncit_code.name: tumor_histological_type_ncit_code
tumor_histological_type_ncit_code.description: The code to represent the histology of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

meta.notes: If biospecimen is a tumor refer to  NCI Thesaurus (NCIt) at http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ncit.owl

submitter_donor_id.name: submitter_donor_id
submitter_donor_id.description: Identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider

meta.notes: Alphanumeric characters along with dot, hyphens and underscores are supported.  Maximum of 250 characters.

submitter_diagnosis_id.name: submitter_diagnosis_id
submitter_diagnosis_id.description: Indicate the diagnosis event in the clinical timeline that this biospecimen acquisition was related to

meta.notes: not required if the biospecimen was not collected for a diagnostic purpose #/notes/id
Collected DateTime

biospecimen_type.name: biospecimen_type
biospecimen_type.description: Description of the kind of biospecimen that was collected

codeList: Cell line - derived from xenograft tumor
Metastatic tumor - metastasis local to lymph node
Metastatic tumor - metastasis to distant location
Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumor
Xenograft - derived from tumor cell line
Derived from allogenic bone marrow transplant
Derived from autologous bone marrow transplant

biospecimen_anatomic_location_source_tex.name: biospecimen_anatomic_location_source_text
biospecimen_anatomic_location_source_tex.description: Indicate the anatomic location where the biospecimen was collected

meta.notes: Use the term that was used when collecting the biospecimen

biospecimen_anatomic_location_SNOMED_cod.name: biospecimen_anatomic_location_SNOMED_code
biospecimen_anatomic_location_SNOMED_cod.description: Indicate the SNOMED CT notation (code) for the anatomic location of the biospecimen

meta.notes: Refer to SNOMED CT https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/Use-SNOMED-CT

tumor_histological_type.name: tumor_histological_type
tumor_histological_type.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3)

meta.notes: If biospecimen is a tumor, Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344

codeList: Cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen

meta.notes: For biospecimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

description.right: Age (in days) at diagnosis of condition

notes.left: This field is only required to be submitted if the donor's diagnosis is cancer
notes.right: This field is only required to be submitted if the participant's diagnosis is cancer

description.left: Indicate the donor's disease status at time of follow-up
description.right: Indicate the participant's disease status at time of follow-up

notes.left: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumors) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
notes.right: If the participant was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumors) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.

smoking_pack_years.name: smoking_pack_years
smoking_pack_years.description: Number of packs of cigarettes per day multiplied by the number of years donor smoked

meta.notes: Not required if smoking history is unknown or if the donor never smoked. Pack-years is calculated by multiplying the number of packs of cigarettes (20 cigarettes per pack) smoked per day by the number of years the person has smoked. For example, 1 pack year is equal to smoking 1 pack per day for 1 year
